comment: He does not do much for the class as every assignment is on Sage but be expected to not be able to reach him. He is extremely bad at responding to emails and is slow with grading but he is not a harsh grader at all. He is also very lenient and if he responds to your email about assignment alternatives, he will give you one.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He is a very nice and caring professor. I talked to him several times after class and he's honestly a good guy. Participation isn't mandatory but he'll give extra credit to those that come. His class was very easy and all the work is online. You don't need to go to class but I would recommend it. Getting to know your professors is super beneficial.

Dr. Killam was probably the best professor I've had at KSU. So good, I added Criminal Justice as a secondary major. He is willing to work with everyone if you're willing to talk to him.  He is very lecture-based but opens the class to lots of discussions. Highly recommend him!

I took him for CRJU 1101 but it was not an option. Pretty good teacher, I did not like his class the first few classes because of the way that he said things, but I started to warm up to him as the year went on. He gave the final exam answers to the class before the final and gave the paper with the exact test, so make sure you show up to classes.
super easy class jsut show up and do your weekly homework and youll pass. hes a super cool guy who loves talking about criminal justice and discusses what happening in the world during class.
Such a chill, funny professor. He grades very fairly and not too harshly, there's one big research paper due at the end of the course but it's spread out throughout the semester.
This guy was amazing and had some very entertaining stories. I would 100% take this class again and I asure you won't be displeased with him.
Really entertaining class

Dr. Killam's class wasn't bad.  He's a nice guy and it's pretty easy to get an A.  He takes forever to respond to emails and doesn't remain objective during lectures, but otherwise he's a good professor.

Easiest class. SO MUCH extra credit, especially on Friday when a lot of kids werent there. Had a lot of online reading but it was super easy. was only graded on online stuff and one paper. Lectures are boring. Final was super easy and he gave a "study guide" that was word for word the final in a different order that you could use on the test.

This professor truly wants to make a connection with his students and makes attending class fun and enjoyable. He was very knowledgable about what he taught and seemed happy to be in a classroom. The only downside is a very unorganized syllabus and you wont really know when things are happening until they happen (quizzes, lectures, etc.)

a wonderful and sweet professor. very easy class and everything is basically online with textbook readings and quizzes. his lectures are good but nothing out of this world. he really cares for his students and i would definitely take him again.

all this class is pretty much online. you have reading with quizzes and videos every week. the lectures are decent but not mandatory. he is the nicest professor i have taken and will do anything to help his students pass
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: He never answered emails and if he did it was after the assignment was due. When he answered he was very snarky even if you were polite. The assignments themselves were easy but the professors rudeness threw me off. The exams line up with the information very well if you study.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Amazing teacher would definitely take his courses again

His exams are open notes and I usually used the textbook that he assigned us. There was also two papers and a research powerpoint due but they were pretty easy. Overall ig you show up and pay attention, class should be pretty easy and fun.

Professor Killam was a good professor. The students that complain about him not being responsive often email him with questions that can easily be answered by Google or by using the tools and links he provides at the beginning of the semester. He does use Lockdown but not video for quizzes. Only video for tests. Overall, it was an easy class.

one of the best professors i have ever taken. his lectures r entertaining and straight forward. he lets u use ur notes and textbook on the exams. his papers r easy. there were 4 tests total. one reflection paper. then one research paper with a powerpoint. very easy!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: By far my favorite professor here. He was so caring and funny and made lectures fun. Attendance wasn't really required, but I  went because the lectures were actually fun to learn about, and he always shared personal experiences. Take this class, or any of his classes if you get the chance, because he was really genuine and cared about his students

Professor Killam is easily the best professor I have had to date. If he has another class I can take I would. Even after I submitted my essay he was kind enough to tell me to relook at my work and the APA style and resubmit. He could have just graded it but he wanted me to get the best grade.

If you have the chance to take him

Prof Killam is my #1 favorite professor. He is the nicest guy and his lectures actually make you want to go to class bc they are so interesting! I took profiling with him and we only had a presentation/paper on a serial killer and 3 total tests. Doesn't take attendance but I recommend still showing up because he isn't great at posting on d2l.

Professor Killam is easily the best professor I have had to date. He was awesome, respectful, and a fun teacher. I looked forward to going to his class! Only a few graded assignments the whole semester including a group presentation in class, a group paper, and two exams. If you have the chance to take him, please do! He is the best!
